ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: the alphabet, basic words and grammar, reading and writing
Came in with no prior knowledge and learned a new alphabet, lots of vocab, and grammar
English language, some vocabulary (500-600 words), and basic sentence structure

I learned the basics of Arabic, including how to greet people, talk about myself and my family, speaking about the weather, ordering food, and more. I found that Arabic was a beautiful language despite its difficulty, and I am motivated to learn more.

Arabic is a very challenging language. In the first semester, we learned some basic grammar and a very limited vocabulary. Most instruction was in Fusha but once a week we would work on Shaami as well. A major focus of the first semester is reading and writing the Arabic script.
I have developed a beginner's level knowledge of the Arabic language that has allowed me to engage in basic verbal and written communication.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Liked the small number of students per section and Sarab was a great teacher. Homework could be tedious sometimes and the tests are no joke. Class is hard not only because the language is hard but just in general.
Exams on Monday is a bit unfortunate and complicates relaxing / busy weekends. Would be nice to have them on Tuesdays or Wednesdays.

The daily homework was the biggest strength of the course. It helped me reinforce my concepts, and without it, I may have not been able to remember a lot of the language.

I felt like the in-class time was not used the best, as we rarely were taught a concept; rather, the class time was used to go over the homework. In my opinion, it would have been even more helpful if we used daily class time to learn the concepts that the homework would test us on.
Strengths include small class number and group work. Weaknesses include abrupt change in level of difficulty.

The course would have been better if it was conducted in Arabic more often. I feel like I came to class ready for the discomfort of more immersion, but explanation usually was in English. I also really would have liked to have a native Arabic language partner to practice with. A strength was definitely the instructor who was a pleasure to spend time with four days each week. She did her best to create a comfortable space for all of us.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: if you want to learn arabic yeah! sarab is the best but be ready to work hard
Yes, if looking for a interesting language
Yes. Great way to actually learn a language.
Yes, I would, for those who are taking Arabic. It provides a solid foundation of the concepts required to speak basic Arabic and sets you up well for learning more.
Yes, if the student is interested in learning Modern Standard Arabic.

I would recommend this class to students interested in studying Arabic for the beauty and richness of the language. I would not recommend this course to those interested in being in the military. It was extremely emotionally challenging to share a space with those people who want to use the language in these ways. There was a stark contrast between Muslim students and students who are of Arab descent and those students who were studying Arabic for military or political ends. If you are in the latter category, please think carefully about the way your presence effects those around you.
If you are interested in learning Arabic, I would highly recommend the course, as it is incredibly engaging and effective.
